page.title: 18LAW AND ORDER IN SOUTHPORT
page.content: The Merseyside is responsible for our area and WPC Ratcliffe is our officer.Merseyside police was formed in 1974 by amalgamation of the former Liverpool and Bootle constabulary with those parts of the former Cheshire and Lancashire forces which fell within the Metropolitan County of Merseyside. It has over 4600 officers. There are 685 men and women in the CID of the police.Detectives must be prepared to work long hours.The CID training is in Mather Lane Liverpool. Fingerprint cases received in 1980 where 18,991 and 2939 identifications were made . The main Merseyside police fingerprint collection contained 234,845 records at the end of 1980. The most common offence in Southport is burglary. The drugs problem is growing.
